muchart 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

    Generate random samples from the gamma distribution

    r_g.Rd

    This function generates random samples from the gamma distribution.

    Usage

    r_g(lots, n, mu, k, ...)

    Arguments

    lots

    The number of lots

    n

    The sample size

    mu

    The mean of the gamma distribution

    k

    The shape parameter of the gamma distribution

    ...

    Additional arguments to be passed to rgamma() from the stats package

    Value

    A matrix of random samples

    Examples

    r_g(lots = 5, n = 10, mu = 5, k = 2)
#>                n_1      n_2      n_3      n_4      n_5      n_6       n_7
#> sample_1  4.313429 1.708499 8.152571 3.600698 3.755826 3.458256 8.0471624
#> sample_2  6.415039 1.172674 3.187028 7.489478 1.597557 2.848635 9.9181530
#> sample_3  1.749530 3.184940 5.597219 7.867771 2.171031 4.055341 1.7770483
#> sample_4 10.911981 5.604967 8.049664 6.942162 9.042873 2.781474 6.2342072
#> sample_5  0.574935 2.621759 2.005193 6.413528 4.123687 2.554486 0.9616674
#>                n_8      n_9       n_10
#> sample_1  9.753122 4.172847 20.8492287
#> sample_2  5.972292 5.072283  6.0399153
#> sample_3 15.806635 3.689529  4.9653304
#> sample_4  1.209742 2.464927  0.8847381
#> sample_5  6.820875 6.832158  3.8336690
r_g(lots = 10, n = 20, mu = 10, k = 3)
